it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.aggregate.support

Class AggregateFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.cnr.isti.thematrix.scripting.aggregate.support.AggregateFunction
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Avg, Count, Max, Min, StDev, Sum

    public abstract class AggregateFunction
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for aggregate functions. Aggregates are all based on an accumulator that is updated for each row that is processed
    Author:
    edoardovacchi

    • Constructor Detail

      • AggregateFunction

        protected AggregateFunction()
        Empty costructor, that we need to specify explicitly in order to preserve the legacy behaviour, i.e. that no info about the type is provided to the implementation class. TODO remove as soon as the new behaviour is tested

      • AggregateFunction

        public AggregateFunction(DataType argumentType)
        Constructor with one parameter, specifying the datatype the concrete function (the implementation class) should expect. Needed to allow passing the type information to the implementation classes without changing the interpreter code. All aggregateF are [F: x, acc -> acc], where acc is either same type as x or a fixed type (e.g. a n int counter). Hence this information should be enough.
        Parameters:
        argumentType - the type of the arguments

      • computeTypeException

        protected void computeTypeException(Symbol<?> r)
        Method used by subclasses' compute() methods to throw error if an unexpected type is received.
        Parameters:
        r - the symbol seen by the subclass.
